awd_titl_txt: Enhancement of Training in Biological Electron Microscopy
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides funds to the Biology Department at Bryn Mawr                College to purchase a Porter-Blum MT-2C ultramicrotome, two                     Diatom diamond knives and an air isolation table.  These                        instruments will be used to establish an ultramicrotomy facility                that will be dedicated to use by undergraduate students                         conducting faculty supervised research projects and by students                 enrolled in course offerings of Cell Biology and Nervous System                 Structure and Function.  The significance of the project rests in               the importance that the undergraduates will be exposed to the                   broadest range of techniques available for the study of cellular                structure and function.  Transmission electron microscopy offers                insight into these areas of cellular research that are not                      available through conventional light microscopical techniques.                  The grantee institution is matching this NSF award with funds                   from non-Federal sources.
